title: Synthetic data generation for system identification: leveraging knowledge transfer from similar systems
abstract: arXiv:2403.05164v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: This paper addresses the challenge of overfitting in the learning of dynamical systems by introducing a novel approach for the generation of synthetic data, aimed at enhancing model generalization and robustness in scenarios characterized by data scarcity. Central to the proposed methodology is the concept of knowledge transfer from systems within the same class. Specifically, synthetic data is generated through a pre-trained meta-model that describes a broad class of systems to which the system of interest is assumed to belong. Training data serves a dual purpose: firstly, as input to the pre-trained meta model to discern the system's dynamics, enabling the prediction of its behavior and thereby generating synthetic output sequences for new input sequences; secondly, in conjunction with synthetic data, to define the loss function used for model estimation. tldr: 本文提出了一种从类似系统中进行知识转移的新方法，用于生成合成数据，以改善模型的泛化能力和鲁棒性。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a novel approach of knowledge transfer from similar systems to generate synthetic data, aiming to enhance model generalization and robustness.
